result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASES: 14CF426, 14CF239, 14CF484, 16CF40 & 16CF120.  Defendant David A Saal in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 3:35 pm.  

No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
14CF239-Count 1-guilty.  Count 2-DRI.
14CF426-Count 1-guilty.  Count 2-DRI.
16CF40-Count 1-guilty.  Count 3-guilty.  Other counts DRI.
16CF120-Count 1-guilty.  Counts 2-4 DRI.
CT on ea, accepts plea, on ea adj guilty & on ea judgment entered.  14CF484-DRI for sentencing

Order PSI, long form.  Agent does not need to be present.  PSI due 8/26.  Bonds cont.  4:19 pm adj.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
